text: What is up YouTube? Today I'm going to show you some secret settings in ping-pong.
I'm pretty sure I went over one of them to do a little tape stop thing but I
want to go over all of them so you understand. So first things first is just
the basic ping-pong.
It has that delay. We'll turn the feedback down a little bit. So if you
right click the top it has repitch and jump. So we'll do the repitch and you're
going to want to turn the time on. Maybe we will go like...
And as you pull the time down it gets higher and higher and if you want to...
And obviously you can control the frequencies up there and then the last one jump.
It's just a little different setting but my favorite is obviously just the
normal fade and then that's going to give you that normal ping-pong delay.
Then the repitch to do like that tape stop stuff where you pull that the time
down. Pull it down and put it up to get a higher pitch or lower pitch and one
done correctly. You can automate it, do like a tape stop, bounce it out and then
kind of clean it up so it doesn't have the tails and stuff and you have a nice
tape stop effect. But those are the secret settings in ping-pong. You
either know they're there or you don't know they're there and now because you
watch this you know they're there. And a lot of stuff in Ableton has a few
settings. I'm pretty sure reverb too. No it was right here. The quality you can
